notes: Paragraphs 0 and 1 are the only paragraphs without assigned styles - they represent the CSI Section Number and Section Name at the document header.

All other CSI hierarchy levels already have appropriate styles assigned: SectionTitle for PART headings, Article for articles (1.01, 2.01, etc.), SpecParagraph for A./B./C. level, SubParagraph for 1./2./3. level, SubSubParagraph for a./b./c. level, and EndSection for END OF SECTION.
The existing template styles adequately cover the CSI hierarchy - no additional CSI_*__ARCH styles needed for Part, Article, Paragraph, Subparagraph, or Subsubparagraph levels.
Created two new styles for the section header elements using derive_from_paragraph_index to preserve existing visual formatting.
